result.execSummary:
The defendant Vincent R. Bourdon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Vincent R. Bourdon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Vincent R. Bourdon was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 32 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 10 places per month and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, no entry into any taverns, bars or any Class B establishments without agen approval for work purposes.

The defendant is not to have any contact with Cheryl Ritchie or her residence.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

The defendant must get an anger management assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must provide AODA aftercare information to P&P.

timeConds.notes: To be performed at no less than 15 hours every 3 months.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

defendant.name: Bourdon, Vincent R.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Vincent R. Bourdon in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:39 AM. Court has plea questionnaire, looks like count #3 will be dismissed and count #1 will be dismissed and read in and plead NC to count #2 as alleged. State, Bourdon and Schultz agree. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea off the plea questionnaire, finds guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - has complied with victim notification requirements - follow joint recommendation - conditions of probation would be: AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars, taverns or similar establishments, maintain/obtain employment/school, 75 hours of community service. Schultz - follow joint recommendation - 1 year probation, was not aware of the extra conditions that State is requiring, was only aware of the no contact with C.R. and continue with AODA aftercare program. Recess to allow Attorney Schultz to go over the extra conditons requested by the State (10:48 AM). Back on record at 10:52 AM. Schultz has gone over the extra conditions reqested, willing to proceed today with those conditions added. Bourdon agreed. Schultz makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Bourdon makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: no contact with C.R. or her home, provide AODA aftercare information to P&P, anger management and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no presence in a Class B establishment without agent approval for work purposes, 75 hours of community service - 15 hours every 3 months, maintian/obtain full time employment (32hrs/10 places), $10.00 fine plus costs, submit DNA sample, right to appeal, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 8, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial on November 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vincent R. Bourdon in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:52 PM. Schultz makes statement in regard to a new complaint filed on this defendant by the State and cannot reprsent him on that matter for stated reasons, asking for a later date to get another attorney assigned for the new case only. State not changing offer on 15CM221 and has no objections to resolving both matters together. Court continues bond and sets this matter for a JT. Court has no objections to Judge Stenz getting this case back or the other case being assigned to him,  Jury trial scheduled for November 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on August 30, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Vincent R. Bourdon in court with attorney Henry Reid Schultz.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:42 PM. Schultz, have not yet gotten to enter a plea and do not have discovery yet. State agrees that discovery has not yet gone out. Schultz does enter a NG plea to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 30, 2016 at 02:45 pm. Recalled at 1:48 PM with same appearances. Schultz would like to address the no contact provision on the bond for stated reasons. State - bond - has not heard from the subject of the no contact but has no objections with the no contact being lifted. Court - bond - denies the request to lift the no contact provision.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Vincent R. Bourdon in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:49 AM. Bourdon has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Bourdon understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, has hired his own (Henry Schultz). Court continues bond, sets for AIA. Defendant to inform attorney of the date and time.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 10:45 am.
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with Charles Ritchie.
